creator: lee@lshift.net
text:
An NPE is raised when validating an XML Signature transform if it contains an
unknown transform algorithm.

creator: raul-info@r-bg.com
text:
Applied the patch in CVS Head, with little changes.

Thanks a lot.

I still get a NPE:-

java.lang.NullPointerException
        at org.apache.xml.security.transforms.Transform.<init>(Transform.java:165)
        at org.apache.xml.security.transforms.Transforms.item(Transforms.java:288)
        at
org.apache.xml.security.transforms.Transforms.performTransforms(Transforms.java:236)
        at
org.apache.xml.security.signature.Reference.getContentsAfterTransformation(Reference.java:433)
        at
org.apache.xml.security.signature.Reference.dereferenceURIandPerformTransforms(Reference.java:603)
        at
org.apache.xml.security.signature.Reference.calculateDigest(Reference.java:688)
        at org.apache.xml.security.signature.Reference.verify(Reference.java:736)
        at
org.apache.xml.security.signature.Manifest.verifyReferences(Manifest.java:317)
        at org.apache.xml.security.signature.SignedInfo.verify(SignedInfo.java:223)
        at
org.apache.xml.security.signature.XMLSignature.checkSignatureValue(XMLSignature.java:590)


Will post test case.
creator: lee@lshift.net

text:
Created attachment 14941
Patch that adds a test case demonstrating the problem and checks other similar conditions are ok
creator: lee@lshift.net
raul-info@r-bg.com
text:
Now your tests pass.
Thanks a lot for the tests, they are now included in the CVS, for futere
generations.
Regards,
